cause.description:
Since 1999, Shalom House has had a significant, positive impact on the lives of many, many women. For the last eight years, ladies have broken the cycle of addiction in the halfway house.
In 2004, we opened a second halfway house. And later this year, 2007, we are opening a full-scale treatment center. Your donation will directly help Shalom House in the start-up phase of the new treatment center.
Thank you for your generosity.
-- Shalom House believes that women who have struggled with drugs and alcohol need a safe place to regroup after receiving treatment but before returning home. We provide that place by offering a structured, spiritual, nurturing environment where the women can learn independent living skills which will help break the cycle of chemical dependence.
1. We hope to help women have a new life without the need for alcohol and drugs in their everyday life.
cause.mission: To provide a safe transitional home for women who have completed treatment for drug or alcohol abuse and need a place to develop effective living skills before returning home.
cause.name: Shalom House Ministries
